title: Stock Rebound Slows as Traders Seek Catalysts: Markets Wrap
content: Stocks traded mixed and the dollar weakened for a second session as large market moves earlier in the week driven by the US-China trade truce moderated.

title: Trump's Mega Mideast Deals; Ukraine Ceasefire Hopes Fade | 5/16/2025 Horizons Middle East & Africa
content: The US announces a 5 gigawatt AI data centre plan with the UAE, as President Donald Trump rounds out his tour to the middle east with another $200 billion of deals; Trump says nothing will happen on Ukraine until he meets with Russia's Vladimir Putin; and JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon tells Bloomberg he is not going to take the chance of a recession off the table as erratic trade policy continues to heap volatility on markets. Guests on the show include Mehvish Ayub, Bank of Singapore, Head of Managed Solutions Advisory; and Rachel Ziemba, Ziemba Insights Founder. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Falls After Spiking on Iran-US Nuclear Deal Uncertainty
content: Oil fell after a short-lived spike as Tehran cast fresh doubts about the status of US-Iran nuclear talks.

title: Gold Declines as Traders Book Profits on US-China Trade Optimism
content: Gold fell to extend its weekly loss, as investors booked profits after tensions eased between the US and China this week, cutting demand for haven assets.

title: TPG-Backed XCL Gets Private Loan From Apollo, Partners Group
content: XCL Education, a school owner and operator backed by private equity firm TPG, has obtained a $400 million private credit loan to refinance its existing debt, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Vietnam, Thailand Lift Relationship Amid Rising Economic Ties
content: Vietnam and Thailand elevated diplomatic ties to a comprehensive strategic partnership and targeted bilateral trade to hit $25 billion soon.

title: Jane Street Index Derivatives Trades Probed by India Regulator
content: India’s capital markets regulator is conducting an investigation of index derivatives trades by Jane Street Group, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: India Is Hot Trade Again as Investors Chase Trump-Era Winners
content: Global funds are pouring money back into India, driving billion-dollar corporate financing deals and sending stocks prices to near a seven-month high, as investors bet that Asia’s third-largest economy can emerge as a winner in President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Google VP Bhatia on Geopolitical Tensions, AI
content: Google VP Karan Bhatia discusses the impact of US-China geopolitical tensions and trade dynamics on global tech industry. He expresses strong optimism for AI adoption and growth potential in the Asia Pacific region, also emphasizing a long-term commitment even as rising trade tensions affect the tech industry. He spoke to Bloomberg's Chief North Asia Correspondent Stephen Engle on the sidelines of APEC trade ministers' meeting in Jeju, South Korea. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Japan’s Surging Yields Put Policymakers in a Tough Position
content: After years of moving at a glacial pace, yields in Japan’s $7.8 trillion government debt market are shifting higher at breakneck speed.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin  5/16/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: EU Can Protect Market From Flood of Goods
content: European Union Commissioner for Economy and Productivity Valdis Dombrovskis discussed the US-EU-China trade environment and how negotiations on tariffs are going. In a May 15 interview with Bloomberg’s Kriti Gupta, he also said that if the bloc was to “suddenly see that there is a strong flood of Chinese goods coming to the EU,” it will have to protect the market.

title: India Block Trades Hit Nine-Month High as Stocks Bounce Back
content: A wave of secondary share sales in India, driven by a rebound in local equities, is pushing the deal volume to the highest level in nearly nine months.

title: ECB Now ‘Relatively Close’ to Terminal Rate, Kazaks Tells CNBC
content: European Central Bank Governing Council member Martins Kazaks said cuts in euro-zone borrowing costs are nearing their end-point if the base case for inflation returning to 2% this year materializes.

title: Live: FTSE 100 at Pre-Tariff Day High, Pound Holds Above $1.33
Bloomberg: The China Show 05/16/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, David Ingles and Avril Hong give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ING Wholesale Bank Chief On Tariffs Impact on Dealmaking
content: ING Head of Wholesale Bank Andrew Bester discusses how tariffs and geopolitical tensions could affect corporate borrowing, deal-making and cross-border capital flows. He speaks with Haslinda Amin on "Insight with Haslinda Amin." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Hacking of Trading Accounts in Japan Spreads to Mid-Sized Firms
content: Criminals have targeted mid-sized brokerages in Japan after the country’s biggest securities firms added additional protection for online trading.

title: LNG Traders Look to Increase Exports to Malaysia, Indonesia
content: Liquefied natural gas traders are looking to sell more of the fuel to traditional exporters in Southeast Asia that are being forced to turn to imports to meet surging energy needs.

title: WTO Chief ' Very Encouraged' on China-US Trade Truce
content: WTO Director Generral Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala says she's 'very encouraged' by the easing of US-China tensions and calls for further progress, observing that the contraction in global goods trade contraction is already lessening. She spoke to Bloomberg's Chief North Asia Correspondent Stephen Engle on the sidelines of the APEC meeting in Jeju, South Korea. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 05/16/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: India Airports End Turkish Firm’s Services Over Pakistan Row
content: India stopped a Turkish company from operating at its airports after Turkey voiced support for Pakistan during a recent conflict between the two South Asian neighbors.

title: Foreigners Revisit Indonesia Stocks on Easing Economic Concerns
content: Indonesian stocks are poised for their first monthly inflow since September as subsiding economic concerns and attractive banking shares lure investors.

title: Leonardo CEO Cingolani: Almost in a War Economy
content: Roberto Cingolani, CEO of Italian defense company Leonardo, discusses Europe's defense buildup and outlook with Bloomberg's Tommaso Ebhardt at the company's headquarters in Rome. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Ice Cream Inflation Arrives Just in Time for Summer
content: Coconut oil, a key ingredient in our favorite sweet treat, is becoming very expensive.

title: Tariff Truce Spurs Pacific Trade Rush, Boosting Global Shippers
content: Importers rushing to ship Chinese goods to the US using a short reprieve from paralyzing tariffs could provide a much-needed boost to global freighters.

title: India Examining US Request to Abolish Curbs on Ethanol Imports
content: India is reviewing a US request to lift restrictions on ethanol imports as it negotiates a wider trade deal with Washington to avoid punitive tariffs.

title: Chinese Gold Miner Chifeng Scours Globe for Takeover Targets
content: A major Chinese gold producer is scouting for acquisition opportunities around the world, although the recent price volatility driven by global trade turmoil means it’s not rushing to secure deals.

title: 'Quite Attractive' Opportunities in Asian Bonds, BlackRock's Saigal Says
content:
BlackRock's Navin Saigal says the current environment is "an exciting one" and perhaps what most investors "are not entirely used to." Saigal tells Bloomberg Television that "what is inflationary at the margin for the US could be deflationary for China and the rest of Asia." He says the disinflationary or deflationary trend is real, but it also creates a huge opportunity for bond investors to add a diversified market to their portfolios.
 (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Romania to Hold Rates With All Eyes on Leu Path
content: Romania’s central bank will probably keep interest rates unchanged on Friday, with investors looking for any clues about the outlook for the leu after political turmoil pushed the currency to record lows.

title: Trump’s Pledge to Lift Syrian Sanctions Faces a Complex Road
content: US President Donald Trump says he’s ready to ease sanctions on Syria. He won’t be able to do it quickly.

title: World Economic Forum Courts Lagarde as Its Next Leader After Founder’s Abrupt Exit
content: Klaus Schwab’s abrupt departure from the World Economic Forum, the influential organization he founded and led for more than half a century, has complicated carefully laid plans to persuade Christine Lagarde to assume the helm in a seamless transition, according to people familiar with the discussions.

title: US Treasury Warns Hong Kong Banks Over Funding Iran Oil Trades
content: A US Treasury delegation met with Hong Kong banks to warn them against facilitating Iran oil shipments to China in April, just a month before sanctioning nine non-bank entities in the city allegedly involved in such trades, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: India’s Jaishankar Discusses Kashmir in First Call With Taliban
content: India’s foreign minister discussed last month’s deadly attack in Kashmir during his first conversation with Afghanistan’s Taliban-led government, as the two sides continue efforts to improve ties.

title: India Airports End Turkish Firm’s Services Over Pakistan Row
content: India stopped a Turkish company from operating at its airports after Turkey voiced support for Pakistan during a recent conflict between the two South Asian neighbors.

title: UK Visa Scams Squeeze Millions From Would-Be Care Workers
content: Recent changes to immigration policy won’t do anything for people who’ve been exploited while seeking jobs in the UK. But they may worsen the care-worker shortage.

title: Romania’s Destiny Rides on Trump Follower Versus Math Prodigy
content: Romania’s track record as a reliable supporter of the European project will be put to the test Sunday as an ultranationalist Donald Trump disciple contends for the presidency against a one-time math prodigy.

title: Trump to Keep 30% China Tariffs Till Late 2025, Analysts Say
content: Donald Trump’s tariffs on China will likely remain at a level expected to severely curtail Chinese exports to the US after the 90-day truce, analysts and investors say, suggesting Beijing may have to endure further economic pain despite active talks.

title: Pakistan Says Ceasefire With India to Be Extended to May 18 as Truce Holds
content: The ceasefire between Pakistan and India will be extended to May 18, a top official in Islamabad said, indicating the respite in fighting is holding after clashes this month brought the two nuclear-armed nations close to a full-blown war.

title: Britain and the EU Haunted by Old Divisions on the Road to a New Deal
content: In the blistering heat outside Winston Churchill’s ancestral home last summer, it began to dawn on Keir Starmer that his plan to reset Britain’s relationship with the European Union would be easier said than done.

title: Crypto Bill Poised for Resurrection After Democrats Hail Changes
content: Crypto-friendly Senate Democrats moved closer to reviving stablecoin legislation sought by the industry after bipartisan negotiators agreed to assorted revisions, including tightened restrictions on money laundering, foreign issuers and technology companies.

title: Ukraine Ceasefire Prospects Dim as Calls for New Sanctions Grow
content: Hopes faded for a Ukraine ceasefire after Vladimir Putin sent a low-level delegation to talks in Turkey, while attention shifted to bids on Capitol Hill for fresh sanctions to bring the Russian leader to the negotiating table.

title: Sparring Over SALT in Trump Tax Bill Threatens Fast Passage
content: Republican infighting in the US House is threatening to sink President Donald Trump’s legislative agenda as competing factions spar over details of the giant tax bill.

title: Trump Argues Immunity in Fight With Truth Social Co-Founders
content: Lawyers for President Donald Trump argued to a Delaware judge that a suit against him by the co-founders of his Truth Social platform should be dismissed or put on hold because he has immunity from such litigation while in office.

title: Trump’s Cuts at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac May Slow Housing Recovery, Report Says
content: The Trump administration’s cuts to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the government-sponsored mortgage giants, may put a damper on the housing market as it becomes harder to obtain some types of home loans, according to a report from Bloomberg Intelligence.

title: Tallying Up the Price for Trump’s ‘One Big, Beautiful Bill’
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior economy reporter Enda Curran looks at the varying estimates of the cost for the Republican tax-cut bill. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Supreme Court Wary of Letting Trump Citizenship Curbs Start
content: The US Supreme Court signaled it is wary of letting President Donald Trump start to restrict birthright citizenship as the justices debated how much power federal judges should have to block controversial White House policies nationwide.

title: Ontario to Sell More Debt Abroad as Deficit, Spending Grow
content: Ontario plans to borrow C$59.8 billion ($42.7 billion) to fund a larger budget deficit and spending on highways and other infrastructure, and expects more of it will come from foreign currency bond sales.

title: Trade War Brings Ontario Budget Deficit to Near Pandemic Levels
content: Ontario’s budget shortfall is expected to reach its highest level since the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic as the effects of the trade war hurt economic growth.

title: Pentagon Says It Has Crafted Initial Plan for ‘Golden Dome’ Defense System
content: The Pentagon has developed a draft architecture and plan to implement the proposed “Golden Dome” air and missile defense system, its spokesman said, as questions mount about the Trump administration’s ambitious project.

title: Trump Touts $200 Billion in UAE Deals in Wrapping Mideast Trip
content: US President Donald Trump has secured $200 billion in deals during a visit to the United Arab Emirates, according to the White House, including agreements involving artificial intelligence that will boost the Gulf nation’s technological ambitions.

title: Voice of America Building Is Latest Federal Property Up for Sale
content: President Donald Trump’s administration is putting the home of Voice of America up for possible sale — the latest in a series of high-profile buildings placed on a list for “accelerated disposal” as it moves to reduce the government’s real estate footprint.

title: Ukrainian Charged in Arson Attacks Targeting UK Premier Starmer
content: A Ukrainian national has been charged with three counts of arson after a series of fires at properties linked to UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

title: War Over Energy Tax Credits Divides GOP in Headache for Speaker
content: Moderate House Republicans are lobbying House Speaker Mike Johnson to lessen cuts to several clean energy tax credits in the broad tax and spending bill prior to the GOP’s plans to bring it to the floor next week.

title: Trump Will Seek 180-Day Waiver to Congress Sanctions on Syria
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the Trump administration will offer Syria initial economic relief by seeking a 180-day waiver to sanctions imposed by Congress, with the longer-term goal of removing the restrictions entirely.

title: Italy and Albania to Host Summit and Deepen Defense, Energy Ties
content: The Italian and Albanian prime ministers plan to hold their first high-level intergovernmental summit in Italy by the end of the year, according to a draft joint statement seen by Bloomberg News.

title: US Seeks to Block Loans to China State Companies in Colombia
content: The US said it will seek to block loans from multilateral lenders to Chinese state companies operating in Colombia.

title: France and Spain Want to Impose Age Limits on Social Media Networks
content: France, Spain and Greece are pushing for mandatory age restrictions for users of social networks including Meta Platforms Inc.’s Facebook and Elon Musk’s X, according to a document seen by Bloomberg.

title: Newark Mayor Baraka Could Face July Trial in Trespassing Case
content: Ras Baraka, the mayor of Newark, New Jersey, could face a July trial for trespassing after his arrest at a private detention facility that would help the Trump administration’s mass deportation efforts.

title: US-China Trade Clash Risks Making Europe Dumping Ground for Cheap Goods
content: China’s widening trade surplus with the European Union is fueling fresh concerns that the 27-nation bloc risks becoming a dumping ground for cheap goods in the volatile tariff confrontation between Washington and Beijing.

content: Source: Bloomberg, 6:21

title: European Leaders Meet in Tirana: What to Expect
content: The sixth European Political Community Summit takes place today in Tirana, Albania. Leaders attending the event include Germany’s Friedrich Merz, France's Emmanuel Macron, Britain’s Keir Starmer and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy. Bloomberg's Oliver Crook discusses what's on the agenda and what to expect. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: As Gaza Crisis Worsens, Is Pressure on Israel Building?
content: The United Nations says Gaza's 2 million-strong population is facing a humanitarian crisis, and world leaders including French President Emmanuel Macron have called on Israel's block on aid to be lifted. As the situation worsens, pressure is mounting on Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu amid signs of strains in his relationship with US President Donald Trump. Jane Kinninmont of the European Leadership Network assesses the situation. She speaks on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe 05/16/2025
content:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

Today's Guests: Jane Kinninmont, Acting Director at the European Leadership Network, Aegon CEO Lard Friese, Marija Veitmane, Head of Equity Research at State Street Global Markets & Quantum Systems co-CEO Sven Kruck  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: France, Spain and Greece Weigh Social Media Restrictions
content: Good morning. France, Spain and Greece are weighing age restrictions on social media. Dior and Coinbase get hacked. And the latest Mission Impossible is greenlit for a China release. Listen to the day’s top stories.

title: Richemont Sales Rise Amid Demand for Cartier Jewelry
content: Richemont SA posted a rise in full-year sales as the continued popularity of its Cartier brand allowed the Swiss group to be more resilient than rivals in a softening luxury-goods market. Bloomberg’s Charlie Wells breaks down the situation.

title: Xi’s Defiance Against Trump Paid Off. What Next?
content:
President Xi Jinping’s defiance against Donald Trump paid off in recent trade talks where the US met most of China’s demands.

China now needs to make sure it is never in a position this vulnerable again with the US. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Xi Seeks New Economic Formula to Dodge Future US Trade Risks
content: China's President Xi Jinping speaks during the opening ceremony of the Fourth Ministerial Meeting of the Forum of China and Community of Latin American and Caribbean States (CELAC), in Beijing on May 13, 2025. content: South Korea’s top shipbuilder HD Hyundai Co. offered the US help with port crane manufacturing, as Washington seeks to revive its shipbuilding sector and limit dependence on China.

content: Singapore Airlines Ltd. warned tariff and trade tensions on top of broader economic and geopolitical uncertainties could hurt demand for passenger and cargo flights.

title: China’s Gen Z Spending Spree Is Fueling a Lopsided Stocks Boom
content:
China’s Gen Z is going on a shopping spree and it's fueling an unusual stock boom. They’re spending on everything from toys to bubble tea — emotional consumption, as some call it.

But is this enough to spur China’s economy? (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Meat Firm Marfrig Makes Offer for Remaining BRF Stake
content: Marfrig Global Foods SA, a leading Brazilian meat producer, agreed to acquire the shares it doesn’t already own in the country’s top chicken firm, BRF SA.

title: SALT, Medicaid Fracture GOP on Tax Bill | Balance of Power: Late Edition
content: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Rep. Nicole Malliotakis (R) New York discusses the timeline of the GOP's Trump Tax Bill and whether or not the bill will be ready to go around Memorial Day. Michael Faulkender, US Deputy Treasury Secretary, states the Trump Administration has inflation under control. Erica York, Tax Foundation Vice President of Federal Tax Policy, talks about the price of the Tax Bill and who benefits most from the proposed legislation. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: South Korea wins in $9 trillion nuclear power revival
content:
As nuclear energy makes a comeback, South Korea is emerging as a winner.

The country has built up the best large-scale atomic-energy industry outside China and Russia, and stands to reap diplomatic and financial rewards, Will Wade reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: South Africa Firm Paves Way to List Cell C Mobile-Phone Provider
content: Blue Label Telecoms Ltd. surged to the highest in almost seven years after it proposed restructuring of its business to ultimately enable a listing of Cell C Ltd., South Africa’s fourth-largest wireless carrier.

title: Alibaba’s Letdown Tempers the Outlook for China’s Tech Revival
content: China’s long-moribund tech sector started 2025 with a bang.

title: Musk’s xAI Blames Rogue Tampering for ‘White Genocide’ Glitches
content: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence chatbot Grok blamed unsanctioned changes to its system for responses this week that included controversial theories about “white genocide” in South Africa.

title: TSMC Supplier GlobalWafers Hikes US Spending to $7.5 Billion
content: Taiwanese chip materials maker GlobalWafers Co plans to raise its investments in the US to $7.5 billion, sating increasing demand as President Donald Trump tries to boost advanced manufacturing at home.

title: The Saudis' Bet on AI Plumbing Needs More Plumbers
content: Huge plans to become a hub for AI infrastructure could fizzle without enough software innovation and talent.

title: ByteDance Aims to Match Meta Sales in 2025 as TikTok Gains Steam
content: ByteDance Ltd. is targeting revenue growth of about 20% in 2025 despite a potential global economic downturn, a pace of expansion that could help it match Meta Platforms Inc.’s global business.

title: Baidu, Bilibili, Lenovo Report as US-China Trade Tensions Ease
content: Baidu Inc., Bilibili Inc. and Lenovo Group Ltd. are among the Chinese tech firms in focus for next week’s earnings, just as the easing US-China trade war brings back some optimism for the sector.

title: FTC Rests at Meta Monopoly Trial, Shifting Focus to Defense
content: The Federal Trade Commission wrapped up its case Thursday for breaking up Meta Platforms Inc. as an illegal social-media monopoly, with the company now set to lay out its defense in the ongoing antitrust trial.

title: Vistra Makes AI Power Bet With $1.9 Billion Gas Deal
content: Vistra Corp. agreed to buy seven natural gas-fired power plants for $1.9 billion, the latest big US generator betting on the fossil fuel to feed the voracious appetite of artificial intelligence.

title: Chinese Startup Trials First AI Doctor Clinic in Saudi Arabia
content: A Chinese startup has opened the world’s first clinic in Saudi Arabia where artificial intelligence diagnoses patients, a key step in replacing human doctors as the first line of medical treatment.

title: Coinbase Hack Rocks the Company That Led Crypto Into Mainstream
content: On the long list of crypto companies that have been hacked, there are plenty of examples of financial losses that are much more painful than what Coinbase Global Inc. appears to be facing from the attack it disclosed on Thursday.

title: Microsoft’s CEO on How AI Will Remake Every Company, Including His
content: Nervous customers and a volatile partnership with OpenAI are complicating things for Satya Nadella and the world’s most valuable company.

title: Applied Materials Gives Tepid Forecast as China Sales Slip
content: Applied Materials Inc., the largest American maker of chip-manufacturing equipment, gave a lackluster forecast for the current period, highlighting the potential cost of the US trade dispute with China.

title: Goldman Sees AI Investment Boosting Structured Finance
content: Companies are seeking vast amounts of capital for a wide range of artificial intelligence-linked projects, including building data centers and fiber optic networks, creating demand for funding in structured finance markets.

title: Trump and His Allies Pave Way for Unconstrained AI Development
content: The White House and some Republicans in Congress have begun to lay the groundwork for a new AI era with far less regulation. But first...

title: iPhone Supplier TDK Readies Batteries Geared for Thin AI Gadgets
content: TDK Corp. is readying a new generation of batteries to power smartphones through AI tasks at a time that major client Apple Inc. is also preparing to launch a slimmer handset.

title: Christian Dior Couture Client Data Breached in Cyber Attack
content: Christian Dior Couture has been hit by a cyber attack, with hackers obtaining some of its customers’ data.

title: Meta Shares Slip on Report That It’s Delaying Flagship AI Model
content: Meta Platforms Inc. shares declined on a report that the social networking company is delaying a flagship artificial intelligence model, sparking concerns about its AI push.

title: Trump Wants US iPhone Production, EToro CEO on IPO | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss President Trump’s call for Apple to stop moving iPhone production to India and instead shift it to the US. Plus, eToro CEO Yoni Assia talks about the company’s market debut. And CoreWeave CEO Michael Intrator discusses the expanded partnership with OpenAI and the company’s first earnings report since going public. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: EU Digital Chief Defends Bloc’s Tech Regulation
content: European Commissioner for Tech Sovereignty, Security and Democracy Henna Virkkunen talks about the EU’s efforts to shape the future of digital competition and innovation as she meets with CEOs and officials in Silicon Valley and Washington, D.C. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trading Platform EToro Makes Its Market Debut
content: EToro CEO Yoni Assia discusses the company’s upsized IPO and how it differentiates itself from competitor Robinhood. Assia joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Inference Use Is ‘Most Important’ AI Trend: CoreWeave
content: CoreWeave CEO Michael Intrator discusses the company’s expanded $4 billion cloud deal with OpenAI and its first earnings report since going public. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Asks Apple to Trade India iPhone Production for US
content: Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman discusses why President Donald Trump says he’d like Apple to stop moving iPhone production to India, and what he’d like to see instead. Gurman joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology”. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ‘Grand Theft Auto’ Delay Fails to Dent Take-Two Investor Zeal
content: Investors in Take-Two Interactive Software Inc. won’t see the latest Grand Theft Auto VI game hit the shelves this year like previously planned, but that isn’t souring sentiment on the stock.

title: France and Spain Want to Impose Age Limits on Social Media Networks
content: France, Spain and Greece are pushing for mandatory age restrictions for users of social networks including Meta Platforms Inc.’s Facebook and Elon Musk’s X, according to a document seen by Bloomberg.

title: ServiceNow Loses Top Sales Leaders in Executive Shuffle
content: Two top ServiceNow Inc. leaders are leaving the software company as it reshapes the upper ranks of its sales division.

title: OpenAI Grows CoreWeave Tie-Up With New $4 Billion Cloud Deal
content: CoreWeave Inc. has secured a deal worth as much as $4 billion to provide additional cloud computing capacity to artificial intelligence leader OpenAI, expanding a tie-up between the two firms.

title: We Should Know Who's Paying for Geoengineering Experiments
content: Funding is growing as rapidly as the public discourse around its research and development, but it’s not a climate-change solution.

title: Sony Debuts Foldable ‘M6’ Headphones With Better Noise Cancellation
content: The $450 WH-1000XM6 are a much-anticipated update to the company’s wireless over-ear model.

title: Benioff Buys Stake in Influencer Agency Whalar Group at $400 Million Valuation
content: Company represents over 300 TikTok, Instagram and YouTube creators

title: ECB Now ‘Relatively Close’ to Terminal Rate, Kazaks Tells CNBC
content: European Central Bank Governing Council member Martins Kazaks said cuts in euro-zone borrowing costs are nearing their end-point if the base case for inflation returning to 2% this year materializes.

title: BOJ’s Most Dovish Member Warns Against Rushing to Raising Rates
content: The Bank of Japan’s most dovish board member warned against hurrying to raise the benchmark interest rate as authorities will need to closely monitor the impact of US tariffs on economic activity.

title: France’s Unemployment Rate Increased to 7.4% in Early 2025
content: France’s unemployment rate edged up at the start of the year, adding to signs of sluggishness in the euro area’s second largest economy even before threats of US trade tariffs further clouded the outlook

title: World Economic Forum Courts Lagarde as Its Next Leader After Founder’s Abrupt Exit
content: Klaus Schwab’s abrupt departure from the World Economic Forum, the influential organization he founded and led for more than half a century, has complicated carefully laid plans to persuade Christine Lagarde to assume the helm in a seamless transition, according to people familiar with the discussions.

title: Malaysia Central Bank Ready to Act as Growth Outlook Dims
content: Malaysia’s central bank said it has the policy room to act as it expects economic growth to fall below the official forecast this year, with US tariffs dimming the outlook for the trade-reliant nation.

title: UK Visa Scams Squeeze Millions From Would-Be Care Workers
content: Recent changes to immigration policy won’t do anything for people who’ve been exploited while seeking jobs in the UK. But they may worsen the care-worker shortage.

title: Tariff Truce Spurs Pacific Trade Rush, Boosting Global Shippers
content: Importers rushing to ship Chinese goods to the US using a short reprieve from paralyzing tariffs could provide a much-needed boost to global freighters.

title: India Examining US Request to Abolish Curbs on Ethanol Imports
content: India is reviewing a US request to lift restrictions on ethanol imports as it negotiates a wider trade deal with Washington to avoid punitive tariffs.

title: Romania to Hold Rates With All Eyes on Leu Path
content: Romania’s central bank will probably keep interest rates unchanged on Friday, with investors looking for any clues about the outlook for the leu after political turmoil pushed the currency to record lows.

title: Trump to Keep 30% China Tariffs Till Late 2025, Analysts Say
content: Donald Trump’s tariffs on China will likely remain at a level expected to severely curtail Chinese exports to the US after the 90-day truce, analysts and investors say, suggesting Beijing may have to endure further economic pain despite active talks.

title: Japan’s Economy Shrinks for First Time in a Year Before Tariff Jolt
content: Japan’s economy was shrinking even before the bulk of US President Donald Trump’s tariff measures took force, leaving the economy at risk of sliding into recession as Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba heads into an election and the central bank weighs policy.

title: Ex-RBA Board Member Urges Rate Pause on High Fiscal Spending
content: Australia’s “very large” fiscal stimulus at a time when monetary policy is around neutral — neither stimulating nor slowing economic activity — suggests the Reserve Bank should keep interest rates unchanged next week, former board member Warwick McKibbin said.

title: Japan Aims for Currency Talks With US Based on Past Dialogue
content: Japanese Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said he’ll seek another opportunity to talk with his US counterpart Scott Bessent next week to discuss currency matters, building on their dialogue last month.

title: Traders Dial Back Rate Cut Bets in Asia on Easing Trade Tensions
content: Markets are pricing in less aggressive policy easing by central banks in emerging Asia’s export-dependent economies, following signs of reduced trade frictions between the US and China.

title: Is the Age of American Exceptionalism Nearing an End?
content: Markets delivered a withering verdict on Donald Trump’s trade war last month. They also may have turbocharged the decline of US economic primacy.

title: Trade War Brings Ontario Budget Deficit to Near Pandemic Levels
content: Ontario’s budget shortfall is expected to reach its highest level since the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic as the effects of the trade war hurt economic growth.

title: Banxico Delivers Third Half-Point Cut as Growth Slows
content: Mexico’s central bank cut borrowing costs by half a percentage point Thursday after the economy narrowly avoided falling into recession and inflation remained within the target range.

title: Nigeria’s Inflation Eases, Boosting Case for Rate Pause
content: Nigeria’s annual inflation slowed in April, shrugging off the impact of a currency slump and increasing the chance of another rate pause next week.

title: Fed’s Barr Says Supply Chain Disruptions Could Boost Inflation
content: Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr said the economy is on solid ground, but warned tariff-related supply-chain disruptions could lead to lower growth and higher inflation.

title: Colombian Economy Beats Forecasts With 2.7% Expansion
content: Colombia’s economy grew at the fastest pace in two years as record high coffee prices boosted the agricultural sector.

title: US-China Trade Clash Risks Making Europe Dumping Ground for Cheap Goods
content: China’s widening trade surplus with the European Union is fueling fresh concerns that the 27-nation bloc risks becoming a dumping ground for cheap goods in the volatile tariff confrontation between Washington and Beijing.

title: Peru Economy Expanded 4.7% in March, Fastest Pace This Year
content: Peru’s economy posted its fastest growth of the year in March, the national statistics institute reported Thursday.

title: Four in Five Canadians Believe Old US Relationship Is ‘Over,’ Poll Says
content: An overwhelming majority of Canadians believe the country’s relationship with the US has permanently changed, as President Donald Trump’s tariffs and sovereignty threats spark widespread fury in the northern nation.

title: GOP Tax Bill Seen Masking More Than $1 Trillion US Debt Hit
content: The cost of Republican lawmakers’ draft plan for sweeping tax cuts weighed in at $3.8 trillion over the next 10 years in one official estimate, a lowball projection that independent analysts say masks the true fiscal hit.

title: Citibank Sees More Currency Pain Ahead for Ethiopia’s Birr
content: Ethiopia’s birr appears set to depreciate further unless the nation is able to boost its foreign-currency reserves and investment flows, and narrow its current-account deficit, Citigroup Inc. said.

title: US Homebuilder Sentiment Slides to Lowest Level Since 2023
content: Confidence among US homebuilders slumped in May to the lowest level since late 2023, as tariffs made it harder to price homes and anxious consumers dragged their feet on purchases.

title: US Producer Prices Fell Unexpectedly in April as Margins Shrank
content: Prices paid to US producers unexpectedly declined in April by the most in five years, largely reflecting a slump in margins, suggesting companies are absorbing some of the hit from higher tariffs.

title: Powell Signals 2020 Fed Framework Language on Chopping Block
content: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said policymakers are weighing changes to key parts of the framework that guides their monetary policy decisions, including how they think about shortfalls in US employment and approach their inflation target.

title: US Retail Sales Barely Rise, Suggesting Some Spending Pullback
content: Growth in US retail sales decelerated notably in April, reflecting consumers pulled back spending on cars, sporting goods and other categories of imported goods amid concerns about rising prices from tariffs.

title: US Factory Output Declines for the First Time in Six Months
content: US factory production declined in April for the first time in six months, marking a soft start to the second quarter for manufacturers encumbered by higher import duties.

title: Richemont Sales Jump on Resilient Demand for Cartier Jewelry
content: Richemont SA posted a rise in full-year sales as the continued popularity of its Cartier brand allowed the Swiss group to be more resilient than rivals like LVMH in a softening luxury-goods market.

title: Swiss Re Profits Up Despite Losses from California Wildfires
content: Swiss Re AG’s profit rose in the first quarter as losses from the California wildfires were offset by positive performance across the business.

title: Waterous’ Strathcona to Make $4 Billion Bid for MEG Energy
content: Canadian oil tycoon Adam Waterous’ Strathcona Resources Ltd. announced plans to make a takeover bid for MEG Energy Corp. that values the oil sands company at about C$6 billion ($4 billion), advancing a push to become a major heavy crude producer.

title: NJ Transit Engineers Declare Strike After Wage Talks Fail
content: New Jersey Transit locomotive engineers will strike on Friday, triggering a shutdown of the agency’s rail service and disrupting travel for thousands of commuters.

title: India Airports End Turkish Firm’s Services Over Pakistan Row
content: India stopped a Turkish company from operating at its airports after Turkey voiced support for Pakistan during a recent conflict between the two South Asian neighbors.

title: Tariff Truce Spurs Pacific Trade Rush, Boosting Global Shippers
content: Importers rushing to ship Chinese goods to the US using a short reprieve from paralyzing tariffs could provide a much-needed boost to global freighters.

title: Europe’s Big Defense Deals Will Find a Way, Leonardo CEO Says
content: Europe’s fragmented defense industry will eventually succeed in creating major players that can take on rivals from the US and China, according to the head of Italy’s largest military contractor.

title: Singapore Airlines to Pay Staff Almost Eight Months’ Bonus
content: Singapore Airlines Ltd. will reward employees with a profit-sharing bonus worth almost eight months after delivering full-year net income of S$2.78 billion ($2.1 billion) that beat analyst estimates.

title: China’s BlissBio Is Said to Be Considering Hong Kong IPO
content: BlissBio, a Chinese company that develops treatments for cancer, is considering an initial public offering in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Distressed Hong Kong Builder Parkview Gets Private Loan From PAG
content: Hong Kong’s Parkview Group has obtained a HK$300 million ($38 million) private credit loan from investment firm PAG, according to a person familiar with the matter, as banks grow reluctant to extend funds to the cash-strapped developer.

title: Why Is Nissan in Such Financial Trouble and Can It Stage a Comeback?
content: Since the dramatic downfall of its “Cost Killer” Chairman Carlos Ghosn in 2018, Japan’s Nissan Motor Co. has labored under an aging model lineup, poor cash flow and management turmoil.

title: China’s Solar Firms to Speed Up Global Push Under Tariff Truce
content: Chinese solar companies will continue their expansion into emerging overseas markets during a 90-day tariff truce between the US and China that brings a more stable trade environment, company executives said at an online investor briefing.

title: Quebec Investors to Acquire Bankrupt Bus Maker Lion Electric
content: An investor group involving Montreal real estate tycoon Vincent Chiara is set to take control of bankrupt Lion Electric Co., offering new capital to keep the electric bus and truck maker alive.

title: Nissan Plans to Shuts Plants After Worst Loss in Years
content: Nissan Motor Co. vowed to close seven factories and slash 20,000 jobs after posting one of its biggest annual losses since French carmaker Renault SA rescued it from near bankruptcy a quarter century ago.

title: Meat Firm Marfrig Makes Offer for Remaining BRF Stake
content: Marfrig Global Foods SA, a leading Brazilian meat producer, agreed to acquire the shares it doesn’t already own in the country’s top chicken firm, BRF SA.

title: Paramount’s ‘Mission: Impossible’ Secures China Release Date
content: Mission: Impossible — The Final Reckoning, the action movie from Paramount Global, won China’s consent for release on May 30, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Lynas Becomes First Heavy Rare Earths Producer Outside China
content: Lynas Rare Earths Ltd. has become the first commercial producer of so-called ‘heavy’ rare earths outside China, refining dysprosium oxide at its facility in Malaysia, it said in a statement.

title: Nissan Doesn’t Need a Savior to Get Back on Track, CEO Says
content: Nissan Motor Co.’s new chief executive officer, Ivan Espinosa, says his rescue plan for the ailing automaker can work even without the help of an outside partner.

title: Chinese Startup Trials First AI Doctor Clinic in Saudi Arabia
content: A Chinese startup has opened the world’s first clinic in Saudi Arabia where artificial intelligence diagnoses patients, a key step in replacing human doctors as the first line of medical treatment.

title: Ex-Goldman Banker Leads China’s Push to Revive Hong Kong Finance
content: The crowd was taken aback as China’s point person for financial matters in Hong Kong laid out plans to re-energize the city’s markets.

title: FDA to Expand Review of Chemical Preservatives Used in Food
content: The Food and Drug Administration is planning to expand its review of food additives beyond artificial dyes, targeting preservatives and chemicals used as whitening agents and dough conditioners.

title: Chinese Gen Z's 'Emotional Spending' Fuels Big Gains for Pop Mart-Crazed Investors
content: China’s attempt to offset the damage of tariffs is getting a helping hand from Generation Z, which is spending big on everything from toys to bubble tea.

title: Virgin Galactic to Increase Price for Space Tourism Flights
content: Virgin Galactic Holdings Inc. said that it plans to charge more for its space tourism flights when it resumes sales in the first quarter of 2026.

title: Buffett’s Berkshire Sat Out Market Drop, Trimmed Bank Stocks
content: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Inc. made no major purchases during the market slump that preceded President Donald Trump’s trade war, instead whittling or selling off holdings in financial stocks during the first quarter.

title: Starboard Slashes Pfizer Stake After Botched Activist Challenge
content: Activist Starboard Value LP sold off about half of its shares in Pfizer Inc. in the first quarter, following a bungled effort to oust Chief Executive Officer Albert Bourla.

title: Trump Is Taking Aim at US Drug Prices. Here’s Why They’re So High.
content: Americans spend more on prescription and over-the-counter drugs than anyone else in the world. It’s true that they take a lot of pills. But what really sets the US apart is how much drugs cost. Unlike in most other countries, their prices are established without direct government intervention. Modest changes under President Joe Biden reduced the expense of some medicines for senior citizens. Now, his successor Donald Trump has vowed to slash US drug prices and bring them in line with those in ot

title: Trump’s Cuts at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac May Slow Housing Recovery, Report Says
content: The Trump administration’s cuts to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the government-sponsored mortgage giants, may put a damper on the housing market as it becomes harder to obtain some types of home loans, according to a report from Bloomberg Intelligence.

title: Hospitals Could Make More Drugs In-House Under Trump Proposal
content: The Trump administration wants to bring the production of more drugs, including medicines like antibiotics that may be in short supply, closer to the patient — including inside the hospital.

title: Cava Avoids the Diner Pullback That’s Hitting US Restaurants
content: Cava Group Inc. sales rose in the first quarter, defying the consumer malaise that rivals have blamed for a slowdown in restaurant visits.

title: Thoma Bravo Sells Remaining $3.4 Billion Nasdaq Stake
content: Thoma Bravo sold its remaining stake in Nasdaq Inc. for proceeds of about $3.4 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Naked Gun Co-Creator Shares Thoughts On Liam Neeson's Reboot, And Explains Why He Turned Down A Producer Credit
content: Naked Gun co-creator David Zucker admits he turned down a producer's credit over disapproval of the new reboot, while also sharing details of a rejected pitch.

content: Ex-NBA star named the man behind the NIL boost after taking credit for Bronny James and Caitlin Clark's one success

content: From touch-screen bags to portable chargers and credit card protectors, shop our on the go savings. Don't miss exclusive discounts up to 70% off.

content: Ella Langley, the winningest person at this year's ACM Awards, has an admission to make about her tourmate and duet partner Riley Green. The mustache was all her!

title: Republican Bill to End E.V. Tax Credit Could Hurt G.M. and Ford
content: A House Republican bill introduced this week would do away with tax credits that had encouraged Americans to buy electric vehicles and automakers to invest in new factories.

content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: Proofpoint To Buy Hornetsecurity For Around $1B
content: Cybersecurity company Proofpoint announced that it plans to acquire Hornetsecurity, a security provider specialized in Microsoft 365 software tools, in a deal reportedly valued at around $1 billion.

title: Venture Capital’s Second(ary) Chance
content: The lack of a healthy exit market is an existential problem for the venture capital industry, writes guest author Dan Gray, who sees the evolving strategy of secondary markets as one solution.

title: DFJ Growth Closes $1.2B Flagship Fund
content: Venture investor DFJ Growth announced it has raised $1.2 billion for a fifth flagship fund, its largest to date.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
